intro: Dendrosicyos socotranus, commonly known as the Socotra double coconut, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It is a member of the palm family, Arecaceae, and is notable for its large, double coconut fruits. The plant has a thick, woody stem that can grow up to several meters tall. Its leaves are pinnate and can reach lengths of over 3 meters, contributing to its striking appearance. This species is adapted to the arid climate of Socotra and is considered a living fossil due to its ancient lineage.
